issue_description:
# [Feature Request]: Update Volunteer Page and Remove Credits Page

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

The Volunteer page is out of date and has a bit of older designs.

The Credits page is also out of date and not entirely necessary. 

### Describe the solution you'd like

Update the "Volunteer" page to updated designs and writing

[Designs](https://www.figma.com/file/U81n9d4jHT1S3HDAmeu4Sd/Oppia-Team%2FCredit-Page-(Diana's-Copy)?node-id=10%3A336&t=cRGN7io0VxlAqnV4-0)
[UXW](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1BmJoZwfF1QkXNGD8eFC3uklYAz45BS9wA4HDFfGhJfA/edit?usp=sharing)

Remove the credits page as it's no longer needed. 

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

issue_comments.body:
@dchen97 @seanlip Anyone of you please correct me if I am wrong . 

I am assuming that we want to remove volunteer-banner  and footer section and have only `Meet our volunteer` section with the updated UI...
The reason why I am assuming this is because all the content of above two mentioned sections has line through it ([UX](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1BmJoZwfF1QkXNGD8eFC3uklYAz45BS9wA4HDFfGhJfA/edit#heading=h.6z575szbgdvp))

I will start working once I am sure what we are expecting..

@dchen97 Could you please answer @Ash-2k3's question? I'm not sure. 

Thanks!

I'm not sure what you're referring to when you say you want to remove the
banner and footer - but please reference the designs - not just the word
file you listed.

I meant to ask that do we need these sections in our updated page ? I got confused as the contents of the section(inside circle) have line through in the docx file I hope this clarifies what I asked previously :)

Yes you should still keep that section. The section you screenshotted in
the doc is not related to the section in the mocks and was for an old
version where we redesigned the credits page which we are not doing anymore.

[image: Screenshot 2023-02-21 at 22 39 37] <https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/98253080/220413389-28973950-5a57-40d6-ba4a-1bc08f965e3f.png> I got confused as the contents of the section(inside circle) have line through in the docx file [image: Screenshot 2023-02-21 at 22 40 19] <https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/98253080/220413783-d519b085-f9cf-4955-ab95-2d7298772395.png> I hope this clarifies my doubt :) — Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <[#17421 (comment)](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/issues/17421#issuecomment-1438830841)>, or unsubscribe <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AC32BW66VSHZ2GAG4JDPPQTWYTZWJANCNFSM6AAAAAAVCPKDVA> . You are receiving this because you were mentioned.Message ID: ***@***.***>
> -- *Diana Chen* *Product Manager | Oppia Foundation* *E*: ***@***.***

Thanks @dchen97 ...I think I have good understanding of what to do now...I will try to make PR within this week...

@seanlip @dchen97 Please check my progress so far and give your feedbacks

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/98253080/220915728-e51592e0-b4b2-408e-ae1c-7519ba9ee3b6.mp4

I have some doubts :

- Should I make two PRs (1 for desktop + 1 for smaller screens) or have all the changes in 1 itselt.
- Do I have to update the images and content inside of carousel . If Yes then from where I can get the new images .
- Do I have to update background image of footer and banner section according to designs. If yes how can I get and add these images.

Thanks !

I'll defer to @dchen97 to give feedback, including the second and third bullet points.

For your first bullet point, please include all the changes in a single PR.

Yes please update the images and content inside of the carousel. Let me check on the images.

Yes also update the background image in the footer and banner. Let me check on the images.

Overall the page looks great though so far! One thought is that there's just a bit too much space between the top paragraph of text in the teams carousel from the first subheader (e.g. in the Lesson creation tab - between the paragraph starting with "our lessons are created by..." and "Construct concise lessons") - I'd recommend making that a bit smaller.

Aside from the images, though, desktop looks great! Looking forward to seeing them on mobile
Thank You @dchen97....Only the background images and carousel ones are to be changed  rest has been done...So do let me know about images when you have updates..

@dchen97 Necessary changes have been made for both mobile and desktop only the images are to be changed ..So do let me know when images are available so that I can create a PR.

Thanks.
Note that there's a way to export images from a figma file: https://www.figma.com/best-practices/tips-on-developer-handoff/an-overview-of-figma-for-developers/#exporting-image-assets-and-svgs

Here are the assets but as Sean said you can just grab them from the Figma file by exporting: 

![Image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12034267/224868297-2a1715e5-114a-4bd4-8519-e9480a0c5a57.png)



![Image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12034267/224868309-76644503-0d3e-4a38-a41b-0f89409af211.png)



![Image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12034267/224868313-38fec2e2-e39c-494c-b966-dc163321e0aa.png)



![Image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12034267/224868315-4fa8d4d2-9326-4ec0-bb44-d2716c4d9dba.png)
@Ash-2k3 Is there anything else you need?
@dchen97 @seanlip , Thanks for providing with resources. I will make PR in a week
@Ash-2k3 any updates on this?

Hello @dchen97, I am currently focusing on high-priority issues related to the Contributor Dashboard team, of which I am a part. Once I have completed these tasks, I will address this issue. If it is urgent, please let me know, and I will prioritize it accordingly. Thank you.
Opened a Draft PR(WIP), will be ready to review by EOW. Thanks

Just a heads up that the PR I created for this issue https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/18071, has already been approved. Just some tests were failing, but I didn't have time to work on it properly. If Anyone's willing to work on this, feel free to use my PR as reference or you can also make a branch out of it and fix only the tests. Thanks.
Not sure if @prafulbbandre is working on this, so I deassigned him. This issue is open for others to take up.
Hey, @seanlip @dchen97 I see this issue is still open and not assigned... I would like to take it up.
Hey @hrshkshri, assigning you the issue, checkout this comment https://github.com/oppia/oppia/issues/17421#issuecomment-1751919657 for guidance.
Hey @Ash-2k3, Thanks... will do : )

Hey @seanlip, @dchen97, @Ash-2k3 ... I just raised a draft PR #19033 
Please look through if any changes are needed.
fixed https://github.com/oppia/oppia/commit/acc8c5b9782e3901f39b17f6c1b75363f34b1b83

code_context.content:
Meet our Volunteers

Our Impact and Responsibilities

Illustrations help learners visualize concepts and are a key part of our platform. Our network of artists create visuals that help facilitate learning and retention of concepts.

Produce Graphics

Create visuals to connect Oppia’s story-based lessons to real-life examples and to illustrate Oppia’s flyers, posters, and social media channels.

Define Design Directions

Work within a community of illustrators from around the world to help define illustration styles that represent the organization.

{{ art.caption[index].content }}

{{ art.caption[index].name }}

{{ art.caption[index].type }}

Our Impact and Responsibilities

Oppia’s mission is to create an effective and easy-to-use learning platform for students around the world to gain access to education. Our learning platform is built and maintained by volunteer developers who share our mission of making education accessible to students of all backgrounds.

Design New Features

Create an accessible UX (user experience) through writing and design on all platforms so that anyone can conveniently learn from Oppia’s high-quality lessons and navigate our website and application.

Improve the Platform

Improve Oppia’s learning infrastructure by ensuring that it runs smoothly and smartly to better support student success and ensure students do not get stuck.

Keep Oppia Running

Improve the overall performance of the Oppia platform and strengthen the technical codebase.

{{ development.caption[index].content }}

{{ development.caption[index].name }}

{{ development.caption[index].type }}

Our Impact and Responsibilities

Our lessons are created by volunteer educators and learners who share our mission of educational equity. Oppia’s lesson creation team produces effective and enjoyable lessons that students around the world can use for free and complete at their own pace.

Construct Concise Lessons

Break down various topics and organize them into short and engaging lessons that cover skills and potential misconceptions of a topic.

Enhance Lessons With Stories

Design creative stories that effectively demonstrate educational concepts to students in a personalized learning experience.

Reinforce Concepts Through Feedback

Implement scripts for our lessons, and give personalized and actionable feedback to learners to help them when they get stuck.

{{ lessonCreation.caption[index].content }}

{{ lessonCreation.caption[index].name }}

{{ lessonCreation.caption[index].type }}

Our Impact and Responsibilities

Through the help of our translators, Oppia’s lessons are available in multiple languages. We need volunteers from around the world to continue expanding available languages so more learners can overcome the language barriers to education.

Adapt Lessons

Translate Oppia’s existing lessons into other languages to ensure that learners can connect with concepts and learn in a language they are most comfortable with.

Create Localized Content

Make lessons more inclusive by making existing content culturally relevant for learners in different places around the world.

Expand Accessibility Tools

Provide voice-overs to lessons in a variety of languages and dialects to make Oppia’s lessons more accessible and complement the existing material.

{{ lessonCreation.caption[index].content }}

{{ lessonCreation.caption[index].name }}

{{ lessonCreation.caption[index].type }}

Our Impact and Responsibilities

Oppia’s main focus as an educational organization is serving under-resourced students from around the world. Our volunteers aim to expand Oppia’s global reach, and partner with organizations to further expand access to equitable education.

Build Partnerships

Establish trust with our partner schools and organizations to get Oppia's lessons in the hands of students. Oppia’s partnerships are an integral part of our mission to create an equitable learning ecosystem.

Develop our Marketing Strategy

Curate content on our blog and Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter pages to reach more learners, and expand awareness of Oppia’s resources.

Be a Community Advocate

Work with local ambassadors, such as students and educators, to introduce Oppia’s educational tools to more communities.

{{ learnerFeedback.caption[index].content }}

{{ learnerFeedback.caption[index].name }}

{{ learnerFeedback.caption[index].type }}

questions_generated: What are the primary tasks that need to be addressed in the issue regarding the Volunteer and Credits pages?
What resources are provided for updating the Volunteer page, and how should they be used?
What confusion arose during the issue discussion about the sections to be kept on the Volunteer page?
In the Volunteer page component HTML, what is the purpose of the oppia-volunteer-banner class?
How does the Volunteer page component manage different image formats for various devices?
What is the significance of the ngIf directive in managing the display of images on the Volunteer page?
What technical changes are required to remove the Credits page from the codebase?
Why was it important to refer to the design mocks rather than the UX document when deciding on page sections?
golden_answers_generated: The primary tasks include updating the Volunteer page with new designs and writing, and removing the Credits page as it is deemed unnecessary.

The resources provided include design mockups on Figma and a UX document on Google Docs. These should be used to guide the redesign of the Volunteer page to ensure it aligns with the updated designs and writing specifications.

There was confusion about whether to remove the volunteer-banner and footer sections, as the UX document had a line through them. However, it was clarified that these sections should remain as the document referred to an old version of a page redesign.
The oppia-volunteer-banner class is used to style the banner section of the Volunteer page, which includes headings, content, and a call-to-action button for applying as a volunteer.

The component uses the <picture> element with <source> tags to provide different image formats (WebP and PNG) for different devices, ensuring compatibility and performance optimization across desktop and mobile views.

The ngIf directive is not directly visible in the given code snippet, but the component uses class-based media queries (e.g., hide-xs, hide-sm) to manage the display of images, ensuring the appropriate image is shown based on the device size.

To remove the Credits page, the associated HTML, CSS, and any backend or routing logic that supports the Credits page must be deleted or refactored. This includes removing references to the Credits page in the application’s routing configuration and any links that navigate to it.

It was important to refer to the design mocks because they provided the most up-to-date and accurate representation of the intended changes, whereas the UX document contained outdated information that could lead to incorrect assumptions about which sections to keep or remove.
